input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
Specifies one or more filter actions for which configuration information is to be displayed. If name is specified
Specifies whether to display IPSec configuration information in screen or tab-delimited format. The default value is list
Specifies whether to allow the display of IPSec configuration information to exceed the screen width of 80 characters. The default value is no

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows XP"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Windows XP.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">netsh ipsec static show filterlist name=${name}</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${level}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> level=${level}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${format}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> format=${format}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${wide}')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> wide=${wide}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported"</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Displays configuration information for one or more filter lists.
